SEARCH
Package org.example.utility.courses

Class Course

java.lang.Object
org.example.utility.courses.Course
public class Course extends Object
The Course class represents a course within the system, providing functionality for managing course prerequisites, fulfilling graduation requirements, and tracking courses per grade level. It is a key part of a larger system that recommends courses based on the student's grade, track, and previous course history.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes

    A helper class to represent the course data in JSON format.

  • Constructor Details

    • Course

      public Course(String courseCode, String courseName, String courseArea, String prerequisites, int gradeLevel, String track, String graduationRequirement)
      Constructor to initialize a course with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      courseCode - The code representing the course.
      courseName - The name of the course.
      courseArea - The area or category the course belongs to (e.g., Math, Science).
      prerequisites - A comma-separated list of prerequisite course codes.
      gradeLevel - The grade level required to take the course.
      track - The track the course belongs to (e.g., Science, Arts).
      graduationRequirement - The graduation requirement that this course fulfills.

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCode

      public String getCourseCode()
      Retrieves the course code of this course.
      Returns:
      The course code as a string.

    • getCourseName

      public String getCourseName()
      Retrieves the name of this course.
      Returns:
      The course name as a string.

    • getCourseArea

      public String getCourseArea()
      Retrieves the area or category this course belongs to.
      Returns:
      The course area as a string.

    • getPrerequisites

      public String getPrerequisites()
      Retrieves the prerequisites required for this course.
      Returns:
      The prerequisites as a string, or an empty string if none exist.

    • getGradeLevel

      public int getGradeLevel()
      Retrieves the grade level this course is designed for.
      Returns:
      The grade level as an integer.

    • getTrack

      public String getTrack()
      Retrieves the track of this course (e.g., University, College, Open).
      Returns:
      The course track as a string.

    • getGraduationRequirement

      public String getGraduationRequirement()
      Retrieves the graduation requirement this course fulfills, if any.
      Returns:
      The graduation requirement as a string, or an empty string if none exist.

    • engine

      private void engine(UserInput student)
      This method checks if a course meets the prerequisites and grade level requirements for a student, and adds the course to the student's course list if applicable. This is the main algorithm to assign courses to the user.
      Parameters:
      student - The student whose course eligibility is being checked.

    • addCourse

      private void addCourse(UserInput student)
      Adds a course to the student's list of recommended courses if the student meets the grade level requirements and there is space in the grade-level list.
      Parameters:
      student - The student to add the course to.

    • fulfillGradRequirements

      public static void fulfillGradRequirements()
      Fulfills graduation requirements by adding recommended courses to the student's course list based on their grade and the graduation requirements.

    • findNextCourseWithNoPrerequisites

      private static Course findNextCourseWithNoPrerequisites(String courseArea, int courseGrade, Set<String> recommendedCourses, Set<String> recommendedGradCredits)
      Finds the next course that has no prerequisites for a specified course area and grade level, avoiding duplicates in the recommended courses and graduation credits lists.
      Parameters:
      courseArea - The area of study (e.g., Math, Science).
      courseGrade - The grade level of the course.
      recommendedCourses - A set of already recommended courses.
      recommendedGradCredits - A set of graduation requirements already fulfilled.
      Returns:
      The next available course without prerequisites.

    • findOpenSpotsInRecommendedCourses

      private static List<Integer> findOpenSpotsInRecommendedCourses()
      Finds the grades in which there are open spots in the recommended courses list. An open spot is represented by a null value in the course array for a specific grade.
      Returns:
      A list of grades that have at least one open spot for courses.

    • findUnfulfilledCredits

      private static String[] findUnfulfilledCredits()
      Identifies which credit areas have unfulfilled requirements. A credit is considered unfulfilled if its value is greater than zero in the credits map.
      Returns:
      An array of credit names that still need to be fulfilled.

    • addNonFilledClasses

      public static void addNonFilledClasses(UserInput student)
      Displays a form to allow the user to fill in missing classes in their recommended course list. If there are no missing courses, the method exits without action.
      Parameters:
      student - The student object containing user input data.

    • getNonFilledClassesResponse

      public static void getNonFilledClassesResponse(UserInput student, String studentResponse)
      Processes the response from the user to fill missing classes in the recommended course list.
      Parameters:
      student - The student object containing user input data.
      studentResponse - The response provided by the student to fill the missing courses.

    • fillCourse

      private static String fillCourse(int grade, Set<String> recommendedCourses, Set<String> recommendedCourseArea, String[] courses, String response, UserInput studentInput)
      Fills a course for a specific grade and updates the recommended courses. Tries to retrieve courses from the API or selects a random class if no valid API courses are available.
      Parameters:
      grade - The grade level for the course to be filled.
      recommendedCourses - A set of already recommended courses.
      recommendedCourseArea - A set of course areas that have been recommended.
      courses - The array of courses for the grade.
      response - The user's response for filling courses.
      studentInput - The student's input containing details like track.
      Returns:
      The course code of the filled course, or "E404" if no suitable course is found.

    • writeRecommendedCoursesToFileCourseName

      public static void writeRecommendedCoursesToFileCourseName(UserInput studentInput)
      Writes the recommended courses for a student to a file in JSON format.
      Parameters:
      studentInput - The student whose recommended courses are being written.

    • sortCoursesByGrade

      public static void sortCoursesByGrade()
      Sorts each String array in the recommendedCoursesByGrade map in alphabetical order using Insertion Sort.

    • insertionSort

      public static void insertionSort(String[] array)
      Insertion Sort algorithm to sort a String array in alphabetical order.
      Parameters:
      array - The String array to be sorted.

    • readRecommendedCoursesFromFile

      public static boolean readRecommendedCoursesFromFile(String username)
      Reads the recommended courses for a student from a JSON file. The file is named based on the student's username and is located in the "src/main/resources/user_class_info" directory. The method populates the `recommendedCoursesByGrade` map with the data from the file.
      Parameters:
      username - The student's username used to construct the file path.
      Returns:
      true if the file was read successfully and contains valid data, false otherwise.

    • runEngine

      public static void runEngine(ArrayList<String> courses, UserInput student)
      Runs the engine for each course in the provided list of courses from the user interests. The engine processes the student's input for each course.
      Parameters:
      courses - The list of course names to be processed.
      student - The student whose input will be used in the engine.

    • cleanPreviousCourses

      public static String[] cleanPreviousCourses(String previousClasses)
      Cleans a string representing previous courses by removing surrounding brackets and quotes, then returns the cleaned courses as an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      previousClasses - A string containing previous course names, possibly surrounded by brackets and quotes.
      Returns:
      An array of course names extracted from the input string.
